title: Direct ink writing of high explosive composites containing metal–organic frameworks
content:
RSC Adv., 2024, 14,31461-31466
DOI: 10.1039/D4RA03241A, Paper
Open Access
  This article is licensed under a Creative Commons Attribution-NonCommercial 3.0 Unported Licence.
Eun-Young Kim, Seong han Kim, Mingu Han, Su-Young Moon
An RDX-based ink containing nanoporous materials and GAP binder was printed on an Al substrate. The patterns containing MOFs demonstrated exceptional detonation properties with long traces owing to the artificial porosity of the MOFs.
